alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 5:31AM CST until February 23 at 6:15AM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Alabama and northeast Alabama, including the following counties, in north central Alabama, Cullman and Morgan. In northeast Alabama, DeKalb, Jackson and Marshall. * WHEN...Until 645 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 529 AM CST, Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.5 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albertville, Cullman, Scottsboro, Fort Payne, Boaz, Guntersville, Arab, Rainsville, Hanceville, Henagar, Good Hope, Crossville, Sylvania, Falkville, Fyffe, Powell, Grant, Geraldine, Holly Pond and Section. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
